evals.prompt: Create a simple todo list app in React with TypeScript. It should let me add tasks, mark them as complete, and delete them.
evals.expected_output: A complete React + TypeScript todo app with proper file structure
expectations: Creates a complete project structure in /sessions/hopeful-lucid-edison/mnt/outputs/frontend-projects/
Includes package.json with React, TypeScript, and Vite dependencies
Includes index.html as entry point
Creates src/ directory with components
Todo component has TypeScript types/interfaces for props and state
Uses React hooks (useState) for state management
Includes ARIA labels for accessibility (e.g., aria-label on buttons)
Has semantic HTML (e.g., <ul>, <li>, <button> elements)
Includes README.md with setup and run instructions
Code includes proper keyboard accessibility (buttons are focusable)
Handles empty state (when there are no todos)

evals.prompt: Build a responsive navigation bar component in React. It should have a hamburger menu on mobile and full menu on desktop. Include Home, About, Services, and Contact links.
evals.expected_output: A responsive navigation component with mobile hamburger menu
expectations: Creates a Navigation or Navbar component file
Includes TypeScript types for props
Has responsive CSS with media queries or breakpoints
Mobile view shows hamburger menu icon
Desktop view shows horizontal navigation links
Includes aria-label or aria-expanded for hamburger button
Uses semantic <nav> element
Menu items are keyboard accessible
Includes proper ARIA attributes for expanded/collapsed state
CSS handles both mobile (<768px) and desktop views

evals.prompt: Create a login form with email and password fields. Add validation - email should be required and valid format, password should be at least 8 characters. Show error messages.
evals.expected_output: A login form component with validation and error handling
expectations: Creates a LoginForm component
Uses controlled inputs with useState
Includes email validation (checks for valid email format)
Includes password length validation (minimum 8 characters)
Displays error messages for invalid inputs
Uses proper form accessibility (label with htmlFor, input with id)
Includes aria-invalid attribute for invalid fields
Includes aria-describedby linking to error messages
Error messages have role='alert' or similar for screen readers
Form has onSubmit handler that prevents default
Includes TypeScript types for form data and errors
